desc: Excellent experience every time staying here, rooms comfortable with all amenities and staff helpful. Very convenient for business trips in/through Singapore. It's located a short taxi ride from airport.

title: Strategic Location
desc: It was a business trip for me. Good location very near to Paya Lebar MRT Station & Paya Lebar Square Shopping. The room was clean 8 out of 10. No iron & iron board for those business travel trip, no hair dryer. Overall was not too bad.

title: Friendly staff, unfriendly room
desc: We stayed for two nights at Aqueen Paya Lebar in a Deluxe Double room. The large bed is located directly under the air conditioner. We half-solved the problem by chilling the room while we were away and turning off the air conditioner while we slept, but our sleep was not entirely comfortable. The toilet is a "smart toilet" that opens and closes when you approach and leave it. But there was a leak between the tank and the toilet. So we closed the door to the bathroom so the constant noise wouldn't bother us. The bathtub/shower was novel but rather unfriendly. There was no holder for the hand-shower, and the alternative was a rain shower. Older people or people with short legs might find it tricky to get in and out of the tub without anything to hold on to. The hair dryer can

title: Suggestion
desc: Hotel location is convenience & room is clean. Suggest more choices for breakfast, consider to have a fitness centre & swimming pool. It will be brilliant if your hotel could have choice of harder mattress, as the existing one is too soft.

title: Great hotel
desc: Great hotel, great staff, great location. The managers and staff are attentive and very helpful. They gave us directions and help to use buses. Rooms are as ice cold as you need them to be. Our room on the 8th floor was absolutely quiet. We never heard a mouse squeak! Hotel is about 1/3 mile from Paya Lebar MRT (subway). Subway conveniently has a grocery store, lots of bakeries, Burger King, McDonalds. Bus stop is 1/2 block away also. Room has refrigerator and a water boiler for tea and coffee. The room also has a safe for free. I will definitely stay here again and will recommend to my friends.

title: overnight stay
desc: its quite close to train station,no room service and the room are really small.its on and off the bed really .i would not stay more than 1 day as there is no space to move .its ok for one night .there is no airport shuttle from the hotel but taxi are pretty good .its shouldn't cost you more than $25.

title: Nice Quiet Hotel
desc: Had a guest stay in the hotel. The staff are very pleasant. Helpful. The rooms are a little small, but compact. The hotel is very quiet except when they have busloads of tourists arriving. However, on the whole it is very quiet. They have a beautiful roof top garden that overlooks the city skyline. Aqueen Hotel is very close to amenities -- food, shopping, etc. As it only less than 5 minutes away from the PAYA LEBAR MRT station where 2 lines run (East West line and Circle line). So you do not have a problem going to the city or the airport. Will recommend this hotel to more visitors for the convenience.

title: Singapore Week-end
desc: Good location near MRT and mall Clean Quiet Friendly staff Everything was ok, maybe only the fact I cannot get food room service ... Restaurant on the second floor was close in the evening ... Good price

title: Very Decent Family Hotel
desc: Location is a bit off from city-center (Bugis/Bencoolen/Little-India), but is 5-6 mins walk to MRT. Has decent spread of breakfast (albeit limited veg options). Receptionists/staff are very courteous.

title: Clean and Tidy
desc: It's a boutique hotel with small room but clean and tidy. Got fridge, boiler and hair dryer. Everything is ready in the room. Nice view. It's 5-7 minutes walking distance to MRT station where there is shopping mall so it's convenient to buy or dine there

title: Great stay
desc: I came twice to this hotel. The place is very accessible . I love the room big and the bed . and very clean , near to shopping mall and MRT and bus station if you want to go orchard. And hotel staff are very helpful and professional and friendly together staff kitchen The food breakfast its good. The price hotel is very reasonable and promotion rate . Next time I will come again together with family. I hope you try .

title: Comfortable and reasonably priced
desc: I thoroughly enjoyed my week at Aqueen. It served my purposes well with a clean and tidy well appointed room, excellent breakfast menu and provision for a tasty and reasonably priced dinner if there was work to get on with rather than going out to a restaurant. Best of all were the friendly staff who were helpful and efficient. For anyone wanting a comfortable and reasonably priced hotel located on a main road I would recommend the Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar.

title: Excellent job guys!
desc: Accomodating staff, smooth transaction, buffet breakfast and the staff attend to your needs quickly is all i can say. worth the price!! the place is very near to establishment such as MRT and Paya Lebar Square so it not a hassle to take public transpo!

title: Old Couple's Review
desc: The very amicable approach of the Receptionist at the desk in greeting an old couple like us,aged 70+, made me thoroughly comfortable in her presence. Ms May,the Receptionist, could make me feel that I was no stranger at a distant country away from my home. I expected Hotel Aqueen to be a place of repute and truly it was. Assistance provided by the officials at the Reception desk was enough to plan my visit to different places of attraction in Singapore.Breakfast served was excellent and nutritious.

title: Great place for a short trip
desc: I booked this place mostly because I was only in Singapore for 1 day because I was on a milage run and didn't want to stay at airport transit hotel and this was very close to MRT station. I arrived early (10AM) and was able to check-in. Which was great, I thought I would need to leave bags at desk while I went out exploring. Being able to check in was outstanding. Staff was VERY friendly and helpful with providing options of areas to go to eat, depending on what your looking for. While rooms were small, they were very clean and would highly recommend, in particular your looking for a comfortable place to stay for a shorter period of time in this area that was not in the downtown core of Singapore

title: I like this hotel
desc: 5 mins walking distance to Paya Lebar Square, so easy to get MRT, food, banks there. The room is not big but clean, the staff are very friendly,nice stay! Based in east coast, so easy to go airport by MRT or taxi, about 20 SGD fare.

title: Overall Good
desc: The overall experience was good. The staff were well-mannered. The room size was a bit small, but for a two-day tour it was ok, when most of the time you stay outside. The hotel location was a bit far from the usual tourist hub, however the Singapore MRT service is too good to compensate for this.

title: "GREAT"
desc: Great Hotel with nice staff. The security for the guest is very safe. The Reception is very welcoming and it has very good service. Very clean hotel. The food is superb and especially the traditional ones.

title: Very Accessible and Clean
desc: The place is just suitable if you're mostly out for site seeings. I celebrated my birthday here and I'm very satisfied. Location is very accessible and just near Changi Airport around 4 stations if you're riding an MRT. Paya Lebar MRT station is just 2 blocks away around 3-5min walk. 7Eleven is just beside the hotel. Paya Lebar Square has all the stores you need from food to clothes. Our room is clean but needs to improve more on lighting. Needs to improve more on service no bellboy on site. Staff are friendly and helpful when we left our luggage just as our flight is still by midnight. Overall, we will definitely come back.

title: Hotel for Business Trip
desc: It is a nice hotel if you are coming here for business trip. Staff are very friendly. Rooms are clean. Generally am satisfied with Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar. Nearest place for food just a 10 minutes walking distance.

title: Not ok for family
desc: They need to think of having a bell boy atleast for families with kids and senior citizens. Breakfast really needs to be improved. Room size very very small. Whatever category they have they should think twice before alloting the rooms to families with kids. Location is good. MRT/7/11 close buy. Some malls at walking distance. Area is relatively newly developed

title: Just got here today and first impression was amazing
desc: Came for an Event of WIEF Young Leaders Network and I was too surprise to know how good this place is, from the lobby to room is just perfect, the quick service delivered at check in and room is just amazing. Let's see how it goes before the weekend

title: Overall satisfy. Will return.
desc: Friendly staff. New hotel. Convenient walking distance to MRT station. Near to airport either by taxi less than 10 minutes or by MRT only 6 stops. Near to Paya Lebah Square n One KM. Can find food around.

title: Good viewing
desc: I can see the city at night, so beautiful. And also the room, look very warm. But beside that, i feel that the room was pretty small. If i just need a room for take a rest and sleep, I'll cho Aqueen again. By the way, It's still good at all.

title: Good hotel location
desc: Still my best hotel choice in Singapore. Near to the office when I need to burn midnight oil. Great customer service team as usual. Made me feel welcome most of the time. If they can improve the in room lighting, it would all be perfect.

title: Good location and service
desc: The staying was pleasant and enjoyable. I like the location very much for is just a walking distance to Paya Lebar Square.The breakfast is not very good for there isn't much different varieties each day. The staff is helpful as he attend to customer request.

title: comments hotel aqueen
desc: No evening meal facilities which meant leaving the hotel. Dont understand how a new hotel opens without dining facilities, just places a burden on a guest to find facilities outside. Bathroom lights very poor, not possible to shave.

title: Clean and New
desc: Clean room and it's very convenience. About 6 mins walking distance to Paya Lebar MRT station, 20 mins away from Orchard Road. A lot of eateries nearby hotel too. Front desks are very helpful and prompt. Value for money.

title: Nice and decent place to stay
desc: A nice, decent and neat and clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The property seems to be newly constructed and is well maintained. Location is close to Paya Lebar MRT and Changing airport. Ambience and reception area is good. Will recommend this hotel for a short stay.

title: Stay at Aqueen Hotel paya Lebar
desc: Hotel very clean. Room small but comfortable. 12th floor or Rooftop has nice views to the city. Good to take photos The local area seems quiet. Five min walk up the road to shopping center where you can buy food. Also Trains close by to shopping center. Management very helpful and polite. Only one negative is if your having breakfast at the hotel get there early as the doors open 7am. The food goes fast and there very slow to replenish. So if your busy and need breakfast before you go out get there early or miss out. Overall a good hotel.

title: clean, good location ,friendly.staff
desc: i love this hotel because of the friendly staff especially Shirley Lim and Fezah....always bringing a smile on their face....room is very neat and tidy,bed is very comfortable....location very good..near MRT near shopping....will come back again

title: Very small rooms
desc: Rooms are very small and cramped.... I chose this hotel only because of the location - as it is very close to my office at Paya Lebar square.... and Paya Lebar MRT. Have eating options at Paya Lebar Square... There is also a 7-Eleven stores nearby..... But the rooms are extremely small..... Even the Premier room.... Only suitable for a solo traveller who just comes to sleep in the night.... Wi-Fi is free and good.....

title: Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff
desc: It was my very short trip with my Sister and her family to Singapore. Was working in Singapore and lived in Singapore before brought me such a nice memory to be back there. Aqueen Hotel offers such a very good price and feel homey and walking distance to the shopping center where you can easily find the food court. Staffs were so friendly and able to accommodate our preference without any hassle. For sure will be back to Aqueen.

title: Comfortable and convenient to stations.
desc: The staff are friendly and helpful. The bed was great, long enough for me (187cm), comfortable mattress. The room was smallish but not a problem. The AC was noisey at times. It's close to to stations 5 mins walk away. It's next to a service station with a convenience store. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport by taxi or train.

title: Clean, comfy and modern
desc: Rooms are comfortable and clean. Small but a good stay for short trips. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Recommended for couples and solo travellers especially for business. Not many eateries around though.

title: Great experience
desc: Staff were very accommodating and efficient. Room clean and comfortable. I checked in very early and had no issues while checking in. Staff were knowledgeable and provided accurate information. I am happy with my stat.

title: Good value
desc: Good place to stay if you want to visit Singapore, centrally located between the airport and city center. Very friendly staff. The rooms aren't very big but I suppose it's normal to Singapore standards. Very clean and modern hotel. There is a 7-11 next door.

title: Nice Place - Great Staff....
desc: I was fortunate to stay at the Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar for 2 weeks. The manager was kind enough to give me a bigger room upon my request for work requirements at no extra cost. The Hotel was good, malls and take outs close by. Rooms are always clean and neat. Staff was very friendly and accommodating and Mr Edmond ( the Manager a true professional) Thank you for a great and comfortable stay. Will be back soon. Regards, Mr Kumaren

title: Enjoyed our stay
desc: We recently stayed at Aqueen hotel Singapore for 3 days & it was very comfortable and relaxing although rooms are very small but equipped with all required amenities located very conveniently as Paya Lebar MRT is very near. I prefered to purchase Tourist Pass of MRT for S$ 20 & plus S$ 10 deposit which is refundable (if refund claimed within 5 days from expiry of pass) available at selected MRT stations. This entitles you unlimited rides in train & bus both for 3 days. Single day pass also available. Morning breakfast is very good & environment of restaurant is nice as you can enjoy it at outside the restaurant in open to sky. Hotel is next to SHELL petrol pump which has Seven Eleven also in it which is a good landmark to locate it. More enjoyable if you get room with a view of

title: Nice Hotel, great staff
desc: Nice Hotel Great staff, friendly, a bit of walk to subway but room was nice and they let me use a shower before late afternoon afternoon trip to airport. Thats all I have to say. What a ridiculous requirement of Trip advisor to have a 200 letter minimum review.

title: 2 Day stay in Singapore.
desc: Aqueen Paya Lebar was recommended by a friend I was visiting and what a great choice it turned out to be. First of all the bed and pillows where up there with the most comfortable I have slept on anywhere. The staff where all friendly and very helpful. No problem with an early check in and a late checkout and they even let me leave my bags there as my flight was not due out till 11pm. Only a 5 minute walk to the MRT, but a taxi fair from Clarke Quay after an awesome night out was only $12 anyway. Cheaper than 1 Singapore beer Haha! $18 taxi to the airport. Highly recommended for great value and good location. Thanks Ai !

title: Very Relaxing and Clean
desc: The place is very relaxing and clean. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. Been going to SG every year for 2 years already and its the only hotel wed always love to stay. Next year we will be coming back and we will still be staying at AQueen hotel. Thanks for the wonderful service.

title: Good stay
desc: Quite new hotel in Paya Lebar Next to a Mall and metro station Good compromise if you can't afford the prices provided by the hotels downtown Rooms are of a fair size and clean I didn't like much the Breakfast but it's just my opinion based on my tastes.

title: Friendly manager with nice smile 😊
desc: Very nice place to be, good food and good service. Was staying for 3 nights on third flow room was super cleaned and size is good too. Specially the manager of the hotel has the best smile among every one at this hotel 😊. Nice stay with positive vibes 🙏 Will be back if I'll be alive on next travel 😉

title: Excelent!!
desc: I have stayed here for only one night with my girlfriend. Our purpose was to explore the city of Singapore and travel by boat to Bintan island the next day. What I liked mostly was that the staff was so willing to help us with everything. I came to lobby multiple times to ask questions about currency exchanges, visas, nearby metrostations and more. I hereby want to thank Joseph, Leslie and May for their kindness. Furthermore, the rooms were clean, the breakfast is of good quality and the location of this hotel is good. I really recommend this hotel to other people who want to visit Singapore.

title: General
desc: Good location for my trip . Feel safe , good internet speed , equipments provided in the room is ok , clean , only one thing is got sound during air con operate it is machenic sound which should come from the expansion machine not blower .

title: Visit to Singapore in May 2016 and my stay at Aqueen Paya Lebar
desc: Aqueen Paya Lebar is relatively a new hotel in Singapore and has all amenities for stay and staff was courteous and helpful. There is also a direct bus (MRT) from Changi AIRPORT to this location. Although Hotel rooms have all amenities and are well maintained, they are less spacious. Hotel Wifi facility is good. I stayed for 3 nights and 4 days at this hotel and visited most of the best places across Singapore. Taxis are available all the time from this location to any part of Singapore. Thanks to Country vacations for arranging this hotel for accommodation.

title: Perfect place to stay
desc: A great place to stay, courteous and helpful staff, rooms are adequate size and clean, good outside view. We luckily got early check in and the staff was great in providing all kind of help. Check in was quick and smooth. Breakfast is very good with food spread. The paya Lebar station and msquare Mall is just 5 minutes walk, you can go anywhere from there. Can't find any cons but If i have to be picky, the location is bit outer side of Singapore but with MRT so close, it doesn't matter. Overall a great place to stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Hotel Review
desc: This hotel situated nearby expressway. Room tariff is quite pricey for such small room.We have to upgrade for better room space. We asked for extension late check out however when we were out they clean up & cleared out stuffs.

title: Singapore visit
desc: Nice hotel , but rooms are small but still very nice stay , easy to Mall , very nearby MRT and LRT ,just walking distance , nice breakfast. Love visit again the most admirable thing is easy to access to everywhere.

title: Clean but small
desc: Good to stay for one person with less luggage. Everything is good except space. It is not easy to open 26' suitcase in the room. However, the overall is a good hotel. Quite and not so busy traffic. Will consider to stay again.

title: Good
desc: The hotel was new and clean. The location is walking distance from the MRT. But I feel quite expensive if I compared to other location such as Bugis, lavender. We can get even cheaper price hotel in close to the bugis or Cityhall.

title: Small but pleasant
desc: Positives 1- very clean and interior felt modern in style 2- safe with reception constantly manned 3- friendly staff- we arrived 6 hours early and they happily stored our bags and gave us directions so we could go out for day- also leant us a travel adaptor for whole stay 4- nice cafe attached for breakfast 5- quiet area so little noise at all at night Negatives- 1- location isn't great for mrt access- you need to take a 10 min bus journey after and then a short walk which is exhausting after whole day in city 2- I booked a twin but when I arrived I was given a queen sized tiny bed which my son and I had no choice but to share. Apparently it was full so they automatically transfer a twin booking to queen if no space. It was full for entire 5 days so I had a 7 year old

title: Right Hotel, Wrong Place (or maybe not...)
desc: The hotel and staff are very good indeed but the location leaves much to be desired. Slap-bang on the junction of a very busy dual carriageway (Paya Lebar Road) and the PIE (Pan-Island Expressway) and right next to a very busy 24/7 petrol station would be bad enough, but the hotel is right under the take-off and landing path of Paya Lebar military airbase with Hercules transports and fighter aircraft going round every few minutes, this is not a quiet location! That said, the rooms do have pretty good double glazing which does keep much of the noise out. There also seems to be a lot of coach tours that use this hotel so breakfast in the morning could be a little busy. The restaurant only serves breakfast, but eateries are only a few minutes walk away at lunchtime or in the

title: Excellent & Sincere Service
desc: This is my first time writing a compliment requested by my wife.Thank you very much to a lady name Shireen.We hope spell her name correctly.We were amazed by her service that me and my wife couldn't do.She has been a great example to us even though her working area is full of paperworks and file but without fail to place her smile an assisted us with our heavy and bulky luggages single-handedly.She even helped her colleague to assist other guests' luggages.We felt so homely and proud to be attended by Shireen.She has been a great example for both of us,very detailed,professional,pleasant,well-groom and we see sincerity in her.A motherly touch and bubbly towards our child.She is able to speak our language.We hope she is able to read our sincere message for her too.We had a

title: Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar
desc: Its a nice renovated property, right near Paya Lebar MRTS and Square...clean rooms, but little squeezed up space... Its budget hotel mainly for business people and tourists...little difficult to get taxi outside as its not major destination, need to book on phone...

title: Functional and Clean
desc: Aqueen is a functional and clean hotel 15 minutes away from Changi Internatiional Airport. Hazzle free check in with friendly frontdesk. Aljunied MRT Station is approx 18 minutes walk away. You can find food at paya lebar square which is 10 minutes walk away. Overall reasonable functional and clean hotel, however if you are not familiar with Singapore, you would definitely be using Taxi a lot.

title: Short stay at Aqueen Paya Lebar
desc: Check-in was quick and painless, ideal after a long and tiring flight. I was in my room within ten minutes of entering the front door. Rooms are quite small, but spotlessly clean and well lit. Bed was comfortable (with far too many pillows!) Good WiFi and plenty of power points for laptop or phone.

title: new and clean, but not restful
desc: The hotel is new and clean, which is great. Location is good. However, certain things are not thought through well by those who have designed the building. Such as: the doors into 4 rooms are located in a small cul-de-sac, within inches from one another. this means that when your neighbours come and go you hear the doors slamming pretty much the whole time. this keeps you awake through the night. if you want to have a quiet night, forget it. there is no sound protection of any sort. in addition to slamming doors, there is also noise coming from the showers and toilets right around you. There is very little space around the sink at the bathroom, which is a nightmare for any woman: where do you put your toiletries and make up? you actually cannot do your make up properly, as there

title: Right for the right reasons
desc: If you are looking for a good hotel and don't want to spend $250+ USD a night, AND want to be in between the airport and downtown, then this hotel is a good choice. Yes, the rooms are small. Yes, the breakfast is modest, but the hotel is new so it's clean and in good working order. The staff is professional and helpful. And it's a walk from the MRT.

title: Exceeded Extra Mile Service
desc: My sincere appreciations to Ms Shireen whom attended to all my needs especially when I requested for my morning calls. I will receive all the morning calls without failed and will went to the extreme level of presenting her extra mile service to me of telling me places for eateries. Since my first day of entering this hotel,I had been observing her service to every of her guests' that she attended to and was very impressed that she will present sincere smile and utmost level of service-oriented professional lady. Not only me but my other colleagues too was very impressed with Ms Shireen when we observed her discreetly. Ms Shireen had been a very outstanding professional lady with warmth and pleasant personality that made me would need to make a comeback and just to see her

title: Comfortable
desc: Nice and very new hotel, clean room and kind personnel. Perfect for business. Just quite far from city Centre. There is a mall nearby for dinner or breakfast although hotel one is quite good. I'll be back!

title: Nice Hotel
desc: We stayed there for 3 nights on our Singapore tour. Great location, near the MRT (Train station), next to Paya Lebar Square shopping center and not far from the airport. You can easily get taxi, bus and train from here. The rooms are clean.Bit small, but comfortable.Breakfast buffet also good. They have a terrace as well for breakfast and lunch.Friendly staff.Only missing thing was a swimming pool. Overall Value for money.

title: for my Hong Kong group total 30 pax
desc: Clean, convenient location,Sales director ms Pansy and Assistant Restaurant Manager very helpful friendly staff . Breakfast selection is satisfactory. Rooms are not too small , with sufficient space to move around. One important drawback - lacking remote control of air-condition operation, the hotel did do their best to help on our hk group my hk group sure will be by to thus hotel again.

title: Rather affordable and good service
desc: Booked this hotel for my regional staff as our office is near here. The hotel is new. It is very near to Paya Lebar MRT, near the CISCO area. Although the rooms are small, they are very clean and functional. Breakfast is also ample and good. Good for business travel or if you are visiting relatives/ friends in the East of Singapore.

title: 50th Birthday trip
desc: We did not book into this hotel ourselves. It was organized by Singapore Airlines as our flight was delayed by 24 hours. The hotel was very clean and intimate. Great food from the restaurant. Buffet breakfast was good. There is a small outside terrace to eat on which was nice. Rooms are small but do the job for a small hotel. Good location near to the train station. When having a shower make sure the curtain is in the bath or it will flood. All in all not bad.

title: Wonderful Budget Hotel
desc: Had a staycay at Aqueen Paya Lebar over the Easter holidays and check-in was efficient and prompt. A Mr Leslie attended to us and he was friendly, polite and helpful and made sure that everything was ok. They really make you feel like you are home away from home. Room was great, service is excellent for a budget hotel and the team members were all friendly and helpful and serve with a smile, which some other bigger or more pricer hotels do not even provide. Proximity to shopping malls and the MRT means eating and travelling is convenient. Would recommend this to business and leisure travellers, especially if they are on a tight budget.

title: Problems at Check-In
desc: I emailed the hotel to inform them I would be arriving late. Upon arrival, there was no one to help with my luggage, nor a single smile or a hello. The taxi driver couldn't find the entrance to the hotel and initially offered to drop me off at the 7-11 next door (this was not the hotel's fault). I was tired from a long day of travel and received my keys quickly. I opened the door and the key card was required to turn on the electricity. It did not work. I returned to the front desk and he called maintenance. He said it would be fixed shortly. It is now 11:30pm and I am sitting on the floor outside the room watching 2 men try to fix the electricity. I asked the front desk if I can simply have another room. I was told the hotel was at capacity. So, I encouraged the

title: Value-for-money because of location and friendly, efficient staff
desc: Near the Paya Lebar station with lots of eateries. Paya Lebar was always half-way between the 2 conferences we attended (Singapore Expo and Shangrila Hotel). A 7-11 store is also right beside the hotel at the gas station. We found the fast internet quite handy and the staff were very friendly and efficient.

title: Nice transit hotel
desc: Place was clean. Staff was nice. Room was small but overall experience was good. Had several short night stay and it would be better if they have better rates. The food serving time during peak hour is very bad as there are very few staff to serve the customers. On 2 separate occassions, i have to wait for 1 hour before my food was served and the restaurant is not even 1/3 occupied. Not a good place if you are looking for a quick bite!

title: A little from the centre of things
desc: This is a slightly out of town hotel but ideally placed for metro (Paya Lebar) which is about a 10 minute walk. We stayed here to be near to friends and it suited us fine. Rooms a little on the small side but excellent all round facilities and the rate much cheaper than central Singapore. Thoroughly recommend this to all.

title: A Hotel just in a Right Place
desc: I would say it is located half-way to-and from Changi Airport and to go anywhere in Singapore is not a problem. The hotel is located where access to public transportation is of easy reach. WiFi signal is strong. Nice Place, Nice People - Great Service!

title: Thank you for your facilities and your service
desc: The room was a decent size with a comfortable bed, good Wi-Fi, an OK television, good bathroom; everything was clean. The hotel is fairly new so the air conditioning was good, no problems with elevators. We tried the breakfast one morning; passable but fairly pricey and we skipped it on the other mornings. We asked for a quiet room and we got exactly what we asked for. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the subway. Everyone at the hotel was professional and pleasant. We would certainly use this hotel again if we return to Singapore.

title: Very new and modern hotel
desc: Newly opened hotel with everything rather new. The hotel lobby is impressive. But do not expect a spacious room. The room is functional with just enough space to put your luggages. There is shuttle bus services provided by the hotels, check out the schedule and destination. It is about 5 to 10 mins walk to Paya lebar square, it is located next to a shell petrol station which there is a 7-11 at the petrol station too, So, this is quite convenient. Smart TV provided in the room.

title: Super Small Toilet
desc: As its a rather new hotel so its quite clean. The service staff is polite as well. Only issue is the extremely extremely small toilet. Hard to explain in words but I think the shower curtain is not a good option to separate the area.

title: Excellent Service and Accomodation
desc: We checked into the hotel for 3 nights after a horrible experience at a rented accommodation from Air BnB. Although it is a 3 star hotel,the service was excellent. My room was very spacious and comfortable. It is contingently located near the Metro Station and a mall. The staffs were very friendly and helpful and I also used their dry cleaning service. The price is worth for all the services provided which include free WiFi (which is a MUST for me. I absolutely hate places where they make you pay for the WiFi after charging you an exorbitant amount of money) All in all, It worth the value of your money!

title: Very Good Hotel
desc: Clean, convenient location, friendly staff. Breakfast selection is satisfactory. Rooms are a bit too small, with not sufficient space to move around. One important drawback - lacking remote control of air-condition operation, so in order to change its setting one must walk to the entrance of the room. In addition - not sufficient light at the entrance, so any time we need to change setting of aircon we need to open the door and use the corridor light (or use the smart-phone flashlight.....

title: First time to Singapore
desc: The hotel is quite far from the city center, however its easily accessible to the Changi airport. Its about 20mins away from the central business district (without traffic). Its quite busy when entering the road from the access way of the hotel, so expect to be waiting to enter the traffic awhile. The staff are friendly and efficient - they are always smiling and provide helpful tips. The cleaning staff didn't seem to understand the reason why I moved the towel from the bathroom to the skin. The facilities were modern, clean and in working order The rooms were small for my liking, however I was staying in a deluxe queen room. I did not like that the bathroom skin was separate from the bathroom itself.

title: Exceeded expectations for a 3 Star Hotel
desc: First and foremost , The moment i step into the lobby , the atmosphere and design of the place brings good vibe in me. My fiancee and I was there to have a look around the place as we were planning to held our solemnization cum wedding dinner. we went to a few hotels before this , we were impressed but the moment we step into Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar , we decided to look no further. It was like love at first sight. We were greeted so warmly by the front desk service officer Shireen , who was well groomed , confident and very polite. She escorted us to the roof top where the planned solemnization will be held , It was spacious , clean and a high glass that barricade the whole perimeter which is safe for kids yet not obstructing the beautiful view.A definite plus point! We were

title: Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar
desc: I was very surprised. I stay in a few Aqueen Hotels at Lavender and Jalan Besar. This new hotel at Paya Lebar have a nice and big lobby and a very nice smell. There is small smoking area just outside the hotel very good for me to enjoy a smoke. The Premier Room is very nice and I am pleasantly surprised that it has a Toto toilet which we Japanese love. This is very good for Japanese on business trip. The bathroom is see through. I cannot say much more about this hotel. Yes, I try the spaghetti olio olio and it's very delicious and order one more. This cafe is also called Petite Menu. Outside the alfresco area you can smoke.

title: Affordable and Very comfortable stay with friendly excellent service
desc: The first impression of the hotel is indeed beyond my expectation, the hotel has a very modern lobby,classic with a style,room were very clean and staff were friendly,you asked them for a place of interest to visit they will give you good direction and helping you to save cost too,there is also a 24hrs convenient store just next to the hotel with many snacks to snuggle away in the room.Overall I would definitely come back to stay with them again and recommend to business associates and friends.Well done Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar!!!

title: Not a good place by any standards
desc: Aqueen Paya Lebar has rooms the size of a matchbox! The room as such was miniscule in size and since we had asked for a triple-bed room, they added an iron cot to the already crammed up space and we were left jumping over the beds to get to the other end of the room as the half feet space between the bed's foot end and wall was all the space left to keep our suitcase. There are locked up balcony spaces which cant even been accessed as there is no place to get there! The bathroom was more roomy than the bedroom and my seven year old was left wondering if we could sleep in the bathroom instead!! The breakfast spread is terrible - if you are a vegetarian, help yourself to bread and tasteless cereals. The food doesnt get quickly refilled in the breakfast nook - not sure if it is

title: Worst Stay Ever!
desc: I have stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Initially they put me on 4th floor but I requested a higher floor due to my insomnia problem. Joseph did finally arrange a 8th floor to me. When I went up to my room, I notice it was directly facing the main road and I can still hear the traffic noise very clearly. They then finally replace a room on 6th floor which is not facing the main road. However, you can still hear the motor bike noise constantly the whole time. I couldn't sleep that night. The next day I can hear annoying noise made by some maintenance work outside the corridor.Even they move me to the 9th floor and not facing the main road, the traffic noise still inevitable due to their poor sound proof design. Besides the traffic noise, you can still hear the next door guest

title: Inflexible staff, treat us like second class citizens
desc: We were put in this hotel due to flight delay. Admittedly the airline paid for the dinner n accommodation. After finishing check in, we were left to find the room ourselves with our luggage. When we front up for dinner, we were told that we could only have 2 choices, ie chicken chops or fish and chips. We asked whether we can have Chinese meals from the menu instead. As it cost less and we rather prefer Chinese food. The answers was out right 'no' unless we pay for them. For drinks we could choose between coke, sprite or water. We asked whether we can have a cup of tea instead as we don't drink soft drinks and cold water. We were told that that we have to pay. We couldn't believe our ears! Bath room was very wet once the shower is used. Water from the shower flowed out to the

title: Great Hotel
desc: Aqueen Paya Lebar hotel is ideally located halfway between Changi Airport and the city center giving easy access to both. You can come from the airport either by taxi ( About SGD17.00) or by the MRT Train. Hotel is only 500 meters from the hotel. Many shopping malls and dining options are around. Famous Geyland Street is just 15 minutes walk away. Hotel is brand new. Modern, clean, a bit unpersonal but this has to be expected. Rooms are fairly small but are well fitted with all the expected amenities. Sound proofing is very good with no noise from the other rooms or from the traffic. Area is very safe. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Value for money is great. I definitely recommend this hotel and I will happily stay there again.

title: A pleasant surprise!
desc: New hotel, opened in May 2015. Special promo (opening) rate of SGD138++ for a Superior Queen Room, quite a steal by Singapore's standards. Quiet location in Paya Lebar, on the Eastern side of Singapore, away from the usual Orchard Road / Marina Square tourist belt. Easily accessible by taxi (let the cab driver know it's just beside the CISCO Building and most will know). Next door is a 24-hour petrol kiosk / mini-mart so you can grab some basic things or late-night munchies. Room while small has a window and its really clean! Has all the basic amenities you need; in-room safe, bedroom slippers, towels, toothbrush. Stayed in the Superior Queen Room which sleeps 2, bed is comfy. Air-conditioning, shower, etc all work well. No funky smells. In-room wifi access is good too.

title: My Eight days at Aqueen
desc: I travelled Europe, Middle East and South East Asia and have a typical requirement, first a place free from noise, and from which if you peep through window, your sight must not be stopped by high rise buildings... ideal I find from where you can have a long look. The second preference is well connected to other places of interest. Third, better served and most important is safety and a welcoming staff. I booked my stay on internet and remained uncertain of the property until I was at the reception... and once there I found myself satisfied on all the above criteria. It is best suited place to stay with a budget and its vicinity will not let you down. An excellent place to live a humane life.

title: New and Helpful
desc: Stayed one night in Aqueen for work. Location is near to Cisco building in Paya Lebar. Nearest MRT station is Paya Lebar for 10mins walk. Mcpherson station around 12-13mins. Since it is near to Shell petrol station, it is easy to buy snacks or drinks. The nearest mall is Paya Lebar Square. They have cafes, McD and MOZ to name a few. Check in was fast and the room is quite spacious. My only complaint would be that my room was near the service lift and emergency door, so it can be quite annoying to hear people/staff opening and closing the door. The staff were very accomodative although it took two phine calls and almost an hour to get an ironing board. I believe the hotel is still adapting and it has very good potential with its motivated staff. Definitely will repeat my stay

title: BRAND NEW HOTEL WITH GOOD PRICE IN SG
desc: Brand new hotel with good price in SG. Normally, almost all hotels in SG is around SG200 and i booked this hotel around SG150 ( breakfast is not included ) MRT from HOTEL which is around 5 mins walk and some food store surround MRT station. Of course Geylang Street which is around 30 mins walk ( Red night district & Chinese Food Store ) Service: 6/10 (just passed as the lift button always not working and those staffs can't help at all / No extra blanket could offer to customers) LOCATIONn： 6/10 (5 mins walk from MRT PAYA LEBAR STATION but a little bit far by TAXI from Orchard road, around SG12 / SG2 and 30 mins by MRT from City Centre from hotel) PRICE: 10/10 (If you are looking for budget under SG200, this is a good choice for you but first if you do not mind the

title: Dr Abbod
desc: Negative points: My room was superior double: it is very small room about 3m X 3m + small bathroom, this small area I think can not accept 2 adult person If I rate this room for 2 person it is 6.5 from 10 When I rate this room for 1 person it s 7.6 from 10 --------- Another bad point: it is easily you can hear a noisy sound of under pressure high velocity water flow in the pipe of the neighboring bathroom of the nearby rooms This indicating bad isolating of the sounds in the bathroom, but I hear no sound from the surrounding room itself Location Stuff communication New furniture Good price

title: Comfortable stay in modern hotel
desc: Stayed for two night 19-21 August. Staff generously allowed us early check in after long international flight (much appreciated). Close to MRT station and we made great use of the public transport system. Comfortable bed, great facilities and super friendly staff. Will recommend to all and definitely stay again. Suzanne, Nelson, NZ

title: Very Clean, new and good
desc: The room was smaller than expected but very clean and well furnished. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Their late checkout service was really convenient and reasonable. The hotel is situated very close to the MRT and a small shopping center. Highly recommended for anyone travelling to Singapore, even first timers.

title: Good and affordable stay
desc: Chose Aqueen Hotel, Paya Lebar, because I wanted to try out this new hotel. When I first arrived I was greeted by courteous front desk Staff and the check in was very smooth. Room is very comfortable and best of all free wifi is also available in rooms. As I was feeling hungry I went down to the 2nd level restaurant, Petite Menu Restaurant to have a meal which was very satisfying. For your info they serve local food and when you are here you must not give it a miss. Generally a good stay and I will definitely come back. Fok Alex Hongkong

title: Great location, near MRT Station, friendly staff, great stay
desc: Hotel is quite new. Room is clean and comfortable. Great view from the roof garden. I can even see the Singapore Flyers. Staff are friendly. Near MRT station. Just a few MRT stations to major shopping area in the city. Great stay!

title: Nice and cosy
desc: The receptionist was warm and friendly... The room was small but cosy... had very nice toiletries layout... inside a box - have the feeling of opening a gift - it has shaver, toothbrush, cotton, shower cap.. very nice brown shade in the room... very clean sheets and good tv channels too... lift lobby was also tastefully done up with the aromatic smell... will come back for another stay!

title: New hotel located near Ubi Techpark and Paya Lebar MRT
desc: The hotel smelled really good and the rooms were clean. One unfortunate experience though was that they first gave us a room with a king-sized bed even if we indicated we want 2 single beds. Next day, they gave us an available room fitted to our request. Breakfast buffet was good. Staff was friendly.

title: Feedback from a Frequent Traveller
desc: The Reception Area has a decor and colour scheme that gave guests a warm feeling as they enter.The Front desk service very polite and efficient. An excellent hotel in terms of room decor and facilities. The room decor was cosy and tasteful. The bedding was firm and toilet facilities were well designed and made of good materials. The room was quiet and with adequate natural lighting in the day. At night the lights in the room was well located to provide excellent lighting. The restaurant has a good selection and tasty food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. International and local food were available. Service was attentive.Overall Excellent Value For The Money1

title: New and clean
desc: Front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming. The lady who attended to us, Shireen, managed to get our rooms early even after a last min change in requests. Going up the hotel had a very modern feel to it and the rooms itself didnt disapoint espescially at the price theyre offering. Had all the amenities you need. Located kinda like at an industrial area but they called a taxi for us which arrived immediately, and paya lebar mrt which is connected to the rest of the city is just a short walk away. Will definitely come back to stay.

title: New Hotel and Good Service
desc: I stayed New and Nice Hotel in Singapore on last Friday d, Walking about 600 Metres from hotel to Paya Lebar Station. I was very impressed Hotel Staff "Mr.Jeffer" he gave the good service and good service mind.

title: Nice stay at Aqueen Hotel
desc: Stayed at Aqueen Paya Lebar in June with my family and booked 2 deluxe rooms. Room is clean, nicely designed, and nice bed!! Very comfy to sleep. Service is good too, friendly staff and willing to assist the guests. Will definitely be back in the future.

title: Cosy stay
desc: New and cosy hotel for business traveller. The hotel has everything a traveller needs. It's near to a MRT station which has a number of eateries, this makes the stay very convenient. If you are going for business around that area, seriously consider this hotel.

title: Clean and well located hotel
desc: The hotel is very well located just 10 minutes walk from Paya Lebar MRT station which provides access to both the Orange and Green MRT lines. There are two malls nearby which make it very convenient. There is a 24 hour 7-11 at the Shell petrol station right next to the hotel. I was generally happy with the delxue room that I got except for its size. The room and shower / toilet was very clean. It had a desk that allowed me to work on my laptop, but lacked enough cupboard space that was easily accessible. There was some space on top of the coat hanger section, but it was just too high for daily use. For the price of this room, I would have expected a bigger room space with more cupboard space to keep clothes. Other than that, I was quite happy with the room. Although the

title: New hotel with room for improvement
desc: I stayed her overnight while visiting Singapore on vacation in July. The hotel is fairly new, and it was very quiet when I was there. It is tucked away behind a petrol station on Paya Lebar road, near the Certis office. Not very easy to find if you are on foot from the Paya Lebar MRT station, so do be sure to get proper directions. It is only about 10-15 minutes walk down the street from the hotel to the Paya Lebar MRT station (served by the Circle line and green line), and the adjoining Paya Lebar Square shopping mall. There is a small restaurant in the hotel, which I did not have time to try, but there are tonnes of food outlets at Paya Lebar Square. The rooms are tiny, as most hotel rooms in Singapore are, but it was more than adequate for me as a solo traveller. If you are

title: Excellent Budget Hotel...Exceeded Expectations
desc: We traveled to Singapore from the 16-19 July 2015. We had called the reservation and confirmed with them regarding the Parking facility provided by them. And the hotel confirmed they provide free parking for hotel guests. Considering this we opted for this hotel. Once we reached the hotel, the main lobby entrance was so pretty and clean that it blew our minds. The colours, the ambiance, the staff all had a welcoming feel towards us and gave us a good feel. Its a newly opened property in May 2015, so considering that the hotel is very modern, well spoken and polite staff who always have a smile on their face. They are well aware so when in doubt if you consult them they provide you the right amount of information. The rooms are clean, modern, smell good with good fixtures.

title: Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar review.
desc: I stayed for one night on a business trip and found the hotel to be an excellent choice of accommodation. The rates were very reasonable and the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant at all times. I would certainly use and stay there again on future visits. The airport is also situated well within reach of this hotel and very useful also.

title: Friendly Staff, nice room and comfortable bed.
desc: I stayed at this new Hotel last Friday during the long weekend. I was very impressed and like the hotel the moment I stepped in. Check-in was fast, and the room is clean. One of the staff was very friendly and precise at directing me the way to1km mall when I approached her for assistance.The hotel is quite near to the MRT station, about 5 mins walk. All the staff over there were very friendly, they smile or greet me whenever I passed by. Thank you for making my stay a pleasant one.

title: Fantastic customer services.
desc: Awesome customer service. Went to visit the hotel before booking. Manager on duty Thomas assisted me and recommmended the best deals. The stay itself was awesome as they really gave us their fullest, adhered to our requests and showed up with complementary gifts. I would return especially for their unparalleled service and comfort of the room! Thank you aqueen paya lebar!

title: Friendly Staff, Tasty Food, Good Price...
desc: My business associate stayed three nights in this hotel. We had few meetings and ate frequently in the café - Petite Menu. We were consistently impressed by the ever smiling front desk and café staff. Food in the café was delicious and reasonably priced. Nasi Lemak, Prawn Noodle and Laksa are the must try. My business associate was extremely pleased with his stay and was very satisfied with the bill on checking out.

title: My stay at Hotel Aqueen, Paya Lebar
desc: Great experience, wonderful and very helpful staff, the room was very nicely furnished with the bath tub as the highlight of the bathroom, exquisite and high quality materials used in the room and throughout the hotel. The location is very good, close to the MRT station and 15 mins in taxi to the city center.

title: Great value for money hotel in Super expensive Singapore with very nice touches
desc: With soaring prices in Singapore, I managed to find a hotel alittle out of the city(Singapore is really small with good infrastructure so it really doesnt matter where u stay, really). Firstly this hotel is new and some where past the city in East side of Singapore after Geylang. First thing I noticed was the spanking newness of the rooms and its grounds, and it made me feel even more safe with a local security company as neighbors. They have a rooftop which has lovely landscaping and beautiful unobstructed views of the surrounding areas. A little quaint yet comfortable restaurant was located on the 2nd floor called Petite Menu, the staff were attentive and the food was surprisingly good and really affordable and didnt burn a hole in my pocket. Great B&B place for business

title: Corporate Hotel
desc: As a person going on business it's about comfort and the service. The rooms in general was good but there are some things which needs improvement. Such as; AirCon facing the bed and having constant cold air blown on you is not great for sleeping. Rooms with no windows, this is just claustrophobic even if the room is not that small. Windows being able to open for some fresh air. Room service definitely needs to be implemented. Overall very helpful and friendly staff - location is central and easy to get around.

title: comfortable Singapore
desc: New property and very well maintained. Very Close to the metro station and shops there. Staff was accomadating... Permitted late check out and later Reception let us leave the luggage with them till it was time for our flight.

title: Location
desc: I cannot express the wonderful service we received from the staff and management. We had a flight cancellation, so could not get there on the day. They were most accommodating in changing our booking. The Hotel itself was excellent, extremely clean and very comfortable. The only draw back was that if we had to stay for a longer period then the room and bathroom was rather small. In saying that I would stay there again and I definitely would recommend it. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the train mrt and a shopping centre with a variety of food outlets.

title: Stay at A Queen Paya Lebar
desc: Good hotel very new and easy to find good location for in and out of the airport. The food was good had a nice breakfast buffet, the hote was very clean and staff was very helpfull. Well worth staying there.

title: leisure
desc: Very nice hotel and comfortable bed. will come back and stay when I have opportunity to come Singapore again. I will let my relatives, colleagues and friends in Bangkok know about this nice hotel and get them to come and stay. This hotel is easy accessible to MRT and can go to City very easy with the direction guide around in Singapore. It is also walking distance to some shopping malls and entertainment places and food centres.

title: Great Stay
desc: On a short break, great holiday with excellent location. Near MRT good location to move around. Lots of food choices around. within walking distance to the Malay village. All staff were friendly and helpful. Will be there again.

title: Great Stay, Great Location, Great Value
desc: Great location close to Food Center, lots of local nice food. Try out their Deluxe Room, spacious and clean, and FREE WIFI! Staff very friendly and attentive. Really worth for the money that i paid for.

title: Very good recommendation
desc: Very kind personnel, new and very clean rooms and facilities. I requested for availability of breakfast before official opening hours of the breakfast room, the very friendly personnel arranged to served to my room with additional charge. Thank you

title: Great location and good value
desc: Staying in this hotel recently, room was good, great location and provide good service. Hotel surrounded with local food and easily reach to some of the shopping complex, it is very convinient. Will definely recommend this to everyone.

title: Awesome Hotel
desc: My husband and I were transferred from a hotel in little India ( because they could not find our reservation ) to Aqueen Paya Lebar . We had a morning flight ( around 7am )the next day . We were warmly welcomed by the reception staff . Everyone had a pleasant smile . On learning our flight was early and being vegetarians the manager , Mr Mark offered to get us breakfast . We did not expect much but the next morning we were gifted with breakfast ( two muffins and an orange juice ) . We were pleasantly surprised by their warm hospitality. This hotel is our choice for our next trip to Singapore .

title: Waking up to having hotel staff opening door into the room isn't pleasant
desc: This is my usual hotel for my business trips. It is a nice, new and clean hotel. However, my stay this time wasn't pleasant as I woke up and was watching the news and had a surprise when a staff knocked the door twice and flashed his card and opened the door! I do not have the habit of putting the door latch nor the 'no disturb' sign on. It is a shock because it was 8.30am and I was getting ready to wash up and go to work. The staff only could apologise and close the door.

title: Great hotel
desc: I was on a business trip last week and spent 3 days at the Aqueen Hotel Paya Lebar. I arrived early, but the nice and very helpful Reception staff could check me in straight away, which was a great first impression. Room was good sized, clean with comfortable bed. Wifi was fast what you do need once on business. The location was also perfect to me, close to the train station, the city centre and the Raffles Place. Will stay here again in September.
